lead_paragraph: A mutinous Serbian secret police unit has agreed to end a week of protests in a dispute over cooperation with the United Nations war crimes court and the unit's role in the new, reformist government, the Interior Ministry said today. The ministry said that the Red Berets, who refused to become part of the civilian police, had agreed to become an antiterrorism unit. The unit will operate independently of the police and secret service.
